meanings.definition: A gift or offering dedicated to God.
meanings.sent1: The family brought a corban to the temple as a token of their gratitude.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the priest accepted the corban from the worshipper.
meanings.sent3: The corban was so large that it barely fit through the temple doors!
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a corban of love, dedicated to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The shining corban illuminated the altar, a symbol of devotion.

meanings.definition: A vow or promise made to God.
meanings.sent1: He made a corban to always help those less fortunate.
meanings.sent2: The corban to visit the sick was fulfilled every week without fail.
meanings.sent3: Her corban to never eat sweets again lasted only a day!
meanings.sent4: His corban to be a better person shone brightly in his actions.
meanings.sent5: The corban to pray daily was a beacon of faith in her life.

meanings.sent1: The ancient artifact was considered a corban by the religious community.
meanings.sent2: The garden was a corban, maintained with utmost care for the divine.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to think the shiny necklace was a corban meant for her!
meanings.sent4: The mountain stood tall, a corban of nature's grandeur.
meanings.sent5: The corban of peace enveloped the sanctuary, calming all who entered.
